topic.title: Viewing a card tree
topic.p: Card trees can be viewed in a number of ways. In addition to the usual List and Grid views, you can choose to view the card tree represented as an explorer-like Hierarchy, or as an inverted Tree.
Card trees can be included in favorites and tabs if they are likely to be used often.

section.title: Select a card tree...
section.p: To begin, you need to select a card tree to view

item.p: From the All, select a card tree from the drop-down list in the header area.

screenshot.alttext: Select a card tree from the All tab

item.p: From the Favorites, select a favorite that is based on a card tree.

screenshot.alttext: Select a card tree from the Favorites sidebar

subsection.title: Configure current tree
subsection.p: The Configure current tree link is displayed in the view header whenever a tree is selected. It allows you to quickly navigate to configure the tree you are currently viewing if you have to appropriate permissions.

subsection.title: Manage trees
subsection.p: The Manage trees link is always displayed in the view header. It allows you to quickly navigate to administer card trees for the project if you have to appropriate permissions.
